author: Matt Webb Mitovich
excerpt: Dinosaur gladiators, messianic cats, string-puppet rock stars play a role in 'Love, Death + Robots' Volume 4 -- get release date, first teaser!
text: Season 4 of Love, Death & Robots will premiere Thursday, May 15, Netflix has at long last announced. “Dinosaur gladiators, messianic cats, string-puppet rock stars… it can only be Love, Death & Robots,” reads the official synopsis. The fourth volume, presented by Tim Miller (Deadpool, Terminator: Dark Fate) and David Fincher (Mindhunter, The Killer), brought back Jennifer Yuh Nelson (Kung Fu Panda 2, Kill Team Kill) as supervising director for 10 “startling shorts showcasing the series’ signature, award-winning style of bleeding-edge animation, horror, sci-fi and humor. Buckle up.” Watch a teaser above!   In other recent scheduling news… * FX’s Adults — a new comedy series created by Ben Kronengold and Rebecca Shaw (The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon) and exec-produced by Nick Kroll (The League) — premieres Wednesday, May 28 at 9/8c with its first two episodes. The entire eight-episode season will be available the next day on Hulu and FX On Demand, while FX will continue to air two episodes each Wednesday. * Season 11 of The Brokenwood Mysteries premieres on Acorn TV Monday, April 21. * Food Network’s Cutthroat Kitchen: Knives Out — with Brian Malarkey succeeding Alton Brown as host — premieres Tuesday, May 13 at 9 pm. * David Spade’s first comedy special since 2022, Dandelion, will premiere Tuesday, May 6 on Prime Video, while Mike Birbiglia’s fourth Netflix comedy special, The Good Life, will release Monday, May 26. * Predator: Killer of Killers, an original animated action-adventure film set in the Predator universe, will premiere Friday, June 6 on Hulu. * Leigh Whannell’s Wolf Man, starring Christopher Abbott, Julia Garner and Sam Jaeger, begins streaming on Peacock Friday, April 18. Want SCOOP on any of the TV shows above? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line!
html:
Season 4 of Love, Death & Robots will premiere Thursday, May 15, Netflix has at long last announced.

“Dinosaur gladiators, messianic cats, string-puppet rock stars… it can only be Love, Death & Robots,” reads the official synopsis.

The fourth volume, presented by Tim Miller (Deadpool, Terminator: Dark Fate) and David Fincher (Mindhunter, The Killer), brought back Jennifer Yuh Nelson (Kung Fu Panda 2, Kill Team Kill) as supervising director for 10 “startling shorts showcasing the series’ signature, award-winning style of bleeding-edge animation, horror, sci-fi and humor. Buckle up.”

Watch a teaser above!  

In other recent scheduling news…

* FX’s Adults — a new comedy series created by Ben Kronengold and Rebecca Shaw (The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon) and exec-produced by Nick Kroll (The League) — premieres Wednesday, May 28 at 9/8c with its first two episodes. The entire eight-episode season will be available the next day on Hulu and FX On Demand, while FX will continue to air two episodes each Wednesday.

* Season 11 of The Brokenwood Mysteries premieres on Acorn TV Monday, April 21.

* Food Network’s Cutthroat Kitchen: Knives Out — with Brian Malarkey succeeding Alton Brown as host — premieres Tuesday, May 13 at 9 pm.

* David Spade’s first comedy special since 2022, Dandelion, will premiere Tuesday, May 6 on Prime Video, while Mike Birbiglia’s fourth Netflix comedy special, The Good Life, will release Monday, May 26.

* Predator: Killer of Killers, an original animated action-adventure film set in the Predator universe, will premiere Friday, June 6 on Hulu.

* Leigh Whannell’s Wolf Man, starring Christopher Abbott, Julia Garner and Sam Jaeger, begins streaming on Peacock Friday, April 18.

Want SCOOP on any of the TV shows above? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line!
